results.title: Little athletics: high jump
results.creator_credit: Shell Company of Australia, Australian Little Athletics Union and Tony Blane
results.brief_description: A young athlete is taught the Fosbury Flop. The run-up, take-off and landing are explained in detail. Includes a series of exercises relevant to high-jump. Gordon Windewyer, an Australian and Commonwealth champion, is seen in action using the Fosbury Flop. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shell Company of Australia, Australian Little Athletics Union and Tony Blane

results.title: Little athletics: discus throwing
results.creator_credit: Shell Company of Australia, Australian Little Athletics Union and Tony Blane
results.brief_description: Alan Launder coaches two athletes through the initial stages of discus throwing. A more advanced technique is demonstrated which is applicable to senior athletes. Safety measures are stressed for class teaching. Exercises to help build up strength and flexibility have been included. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shell Company of Australia, Australian Little Athletics Union and Tony Blane

results.title: Litter
results.brief_description: A film designed to alert children to the problems of littering. A koala puppet shows children in the audience of a puppet show, several examples of public places spoiled and contaminated by litterbugs. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Literature application: stories
results.brief_description: A literature teacher shows a student who runs a marionette theatre how to appreciate a good story: by studying its plot, characters and setting.

results.title: Literacy for a lifetime
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Ben Cardillo and Paul Hawker
results.brief_description: In today’s society, the ability to communicate effectively is vital, and people communicate with each other in many ways. Joan Rothery shows how to apply the principles of written communication and their effect on written literacy in the primary school. Teacher’s notes prepared by Jim Martin and Joan Rothery.

results.title: Literacy and common sense: a year 6 student encounter with print
results.creator_credit: Open College of Further Education (S. Aust.) and Rick Cavaggion
results.brief_description: Don Holdaway, noted literacy development educator, gives a lesson in which the children anticipate the words and line endings in a poem. In conversation with Ralph Fairbrother, he relates this to recent research into reading and a “reading for meaning” approach.

results.title: Literacy and common sense (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Open College of Further Education (S. Aust.)
results.brief_description: Don Holdaway demonstrates a lesson in literacy with primary school children. Discusses his teaching methods and how they can be adapted to suit most classroom situations. Author of set text “Foundations of Literacy”.

results.title: Lit's treasurehunt
results.brief_description:
Lit’s Treasurehunt is a multimedia game for children between the ages of 4 - 7. The main character, Lit, is stranded on an island. A pirate named One-eye asks Lit to help him recover his lost treasure. To do so, Lit has to explore the island and solve a series of tasks.

Lit’s Treasurehunt won the student multimedia catagorey of the Designation Awards, 2002.

results.title: Liszt and his music
results.brief_description: The life of Franz Liszt, as musical composer, performer and teacher presented against a background of the European capitals where he composed and performed. Includes excerpts from the following works: Concerto No. 1 in E Flat Mojor; Hungarian Rhapsody No. 2; Sonata in B Minor and Les Preludes. Particular attention is given to the latter piece as an example of the symphonic poem.

results.title: Listening: a key to problem solving
results.creator_credit: Paramount Communications, A. Scott Miller, Robert Boucher and Donald R. Ham
results.brief_description: A dramatised view of how well listening occurs in an office situation. An employee is promoted despite his verbal and non verbal objections, and problems arise. Solutions to the problem are explored as the film points out listening techniques which will reduce problems and improve working relationships.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paramount Communications, A. Scott Miller, Robert Boucher and Donald R. Ham
